page.title: 14CHANGING AGRICULTURE
page.content: Although traditionally a live-stock rearing area there has been a change to more cereal cultivation - wheat and some barley. Some hedges have been removed to make larger fields. This fact and the modern machinery make cereal harvesting much quicker and easier than in the past. Price guarantees to farmers by E.E.C. intervention have also encouraged farmers to grow more cereals. There are fewer farms but they are larger. Many old farmhouses are now private residences with a small paddock or 2 for a pony. Though cereal production has increased farms can support as much stock as previously because of increased effciency in grass growing. One local farmer told us that 40 years ago a cow needed 2 acres of grazing now only 1 acre is needed. {D Skan
